summary: This is a DOJ Office of the Inspector General interview transcript from September 29, 2021, with a Bureau of Prisons electronics technician at MCC New York regarding the failure of the camera recording system around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019. The interview focuses on when the technician learned about the recording failures, his attempts to fix them, and the institutional failures that led to the lack of video evidence.

keyFacts: The camera recording system at MCC had catastrophic failures with DVR-2 on July 29, 2019, and no recordings were available after that date according to technical analysis.
The electronics technician learned of the recording failure on August 8, 2019, but couldn't fix it until August 10th due to access issues to the DVR room.
Replacing the two failed hard drives would have wiped all existing video data, making recovery of any potential recordings impossible.
A new camera system had been on premises for months but wasn't installed until after Epstein's death due to lack of institutional priority.
The technician stated camera failures were a recurring problem at MCC that wasn't treated as a priority until after Epstein's death.
